intro: Gomesa sessilis, commonly known as the sessile gomesia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that typically range in color from white to pink. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in humid lowland areas. The plant is not widely cultivated but is of interest to botanists due to its unique floral structure and ecological adaptations.
